document_data.name: Johan Kist
document_data.mainbody: '''Johan Kist''' was a talented [[Red Wizards of Thay]] and the inventor of ''[[the Nomad's ring]]s'', active some years before the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History: Johan Kist was still a young and promising Red Wizard when he created the first of the ''Nomad's rings''. His apprentice attempted to claim the invention after stealing the [[ring]]. The thief was quickly apprehended by Johan and in retaliation, he created a [[spell]] that caused its target's flesh to peel away in small strips. As of the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, Johan Kist kept the torturous spell to himself, never sharing its magic formulas.
